headline: Tom Brady’s mystery ‘motherf–ker’ QB might have been Ryan Fitzpatrick
author: Ryan Glasspiegel
sentences: Last summer, on an episode of “The Shop” on HBO, Tom Brady was incredulous about an unnamed team sticking with an unnamed quarterback the previous offseason when he was a free agent and ultimately signed with the Buccaneers.
Unless Brady reveals the answer himself at some point, there will always be a sliver of mystery about whom he was talking about.
So … could that mean Ryan Fitzpatrick, the Dolphins quarterback at the time, was “that motherf–ker” Brady was talking about?
In 2019 — Brady’s final season with the New England Patriots — the Dolphins went 5-8 in games started by Fitzpatrick.
At the time, the consensus was that he was referring to the 49ers and his former Patriots understudy Jimmy Garoppolo.
Flores alleges Dolphins owner Stephen Ross tried to induce him to tamper with an unnamed quarterback on a yacht.
That changed this week, however, with the Brian Flores discrimination lawsuit against the NFL and its 32 teams.
A slew of internet sleuths think so, and they were given a megaphone by ex-NFLer-turned-media star Pat McAfee.
A mystery thought to have been solved has been reopened in light of recent events.
The Palm Beach Post swiftly reported that unnamed quarterback to be Brady.
“One of the teams, they weren’t interested at the very end.
I was thinking, ‘You’re sticking with that motherf–ker?
